item.description: [CNW Group] - Canadians trim their holiday shopping, but many still expect to go over budget: CIBC Poll

item.title: Canadians trim their holiday shopping, but many still expect to go over budget: CIBC Poll
item.description: [PR Newswire] - TORONTO, Dec. 16, 2016 /CNW/ - Canadians plan to spend an average of nearly $600 on this year's holiday shopping, 8 per cent less than last year, yet more than half (51 per cent) expect to go over budget in the exuberance of the festive season, a new CIBC (CM.TO) (CM) poll finds. "The danger comes from what's not wrapped – the entertaining, travelling, or even tempting Boxing Day sales and New Year's festivities," says David Nicholson, Vice-President, CIBC Imperial Service. Albertans will spend 6 per cent more this season at $688, while Ontarians and Quebecers cut their holiday shopping budgets by 12 per cent and 10 per cent, respectively.

item.title: Dodig: Willing to Wait Out Rally on PrivateBancorp Deal
CIBC Willing to Wait Out Rally on PrivateBancorp Deal, CEO Says
PRESS DIGEST- Canada-Dec 9
ETFs with exposure to Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce : December 7, 2016
[$$] PrivateBancorp Postpones Shareholder Vote on CIBC Offer
PrivateBancorp delays shareholder vote on CIBC takeover
PrivateBancorp Postpones Vote on $3.96 Billion CIBC Bid
CIBC Comments on Postponement of PrivateBancorp Special Meeting
item.description: [PR Newswire] - TORONTO, Dec. 7, 2016 /CNW/ - CIBC (CM.TO) (CM) today commented on the announcement by PrivateBancorp, Inc. (PVTB) that the PrivateBancorp Board of Directors has postponed the Special Meeting of Shareholders scheduled for December 8, 2016, to approve the merger with CIBC. PrivateBancorp has announced that a new record date for the meeting is expected to be set for early in the first calendar quarter of 2017. "We remain committed to this transaction on the agreed terms, which were established by both companies based on our analysis of the fundamental, long-term merits of the combination," says Victor Dodig, President and CEO of CIBC.

item.title: CIBC Comments on Postponement of PrivateBancorp Special Meeting
item.description: [CNW Group] - CIBC Comments on Postponement of PrivateBancorp Special Meeting

item.title: PrivateBancorp Postpones Special Meeting of Stockholders
item.description: [PR Newswire] - CHICAGO, Dec. 7, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- PrivateBancorp, Inc. (PVTB) announced today that the special meeting of PrivateBancorp stockholders to vote on the merger with Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CM) (CM), which had been scheduled for December 8, 2016, has been postponed. A new record date for the meeting is expected to be set for early in the first calendar quarter of 2017. The new record date, as well as the new date, time and location for the special meeting, will be announced at a future date. James Guyette, Chairman of the Board of Directors of PrivateBancorp, said, "Our Board of Directors and management team remain committed to this transaction and working with CIBC to obtain the required regulatory and shareholder approvals.
